title: Equipment Drag and Drop Functionality
description: Verify that equipment can be dragged from the toolbar and dropped onto the virtual stage canvas, and that the placed equipment is draggable to reposition.

steps.description: Open the game level selection and select a level.
Drag an equipment item from the toolbar onto the stage canvas.
Verify that the equipment appears on the canvas at the drop position.
Click and drag the placed equipment to a new position on the canvas.
Verify that the equipment moves smoothly and updates its position without visual glitches.
Attempt to drag equipment outside the stage boundaries.
Verify that the equipment position is constrained within the canvas boundaries with no overflow or clipping.

title: Cable Connection Creation and Validation
description: Test the creation of cable connections between equipment connectors with correct cable type selection and real-time validation feedback.

steps.description: Place appropriate pairs of equipment on the canvas with connectors visible.
Click a connector point on the first equipment to start a cable connection.
Select the appropriate cable type for the connection from the options presented.
Click the connector point on the second equipment to complete the connection.
Verify that the connection line (SVG) appears between the connectors with the correct cable color.
Verify that the system validates the connection in real-time, displaying correct (green) or incorrect (red) visual feedback.

title: Connection Validation Error Handling
description: Ensure the system correctly identifies invalid connections and provides clear visual feedback for errors.

steps.description: Place equipment on the stage with connectors incompatible for connection.
Attempt to create a cable connection using an invalid cable type.
Verify the connection line shows error color and/or animation indicating invalid connection.
Attempt to connect incompatible connector types.
Verify the system blocks or flags the connection attempt with an error message or visual indicator.

title: Equipment Information Popup Accessibility and Accuracy
description: Verify that clicking the question mark icon on any equipment opens a detailed information popup with correct content.

steps.description: Place equipment on the stage.
Click on the question mark icon of a placed equipment.
Verify that an information popup appears displaying detailed and accurate information about the equipment.
Click outside the popup or on a close control.
Verify that the popup closes correctly.
Repeat the process for multiple equipment types.
Verify that each popup shows relevant and distinct information per equipment type.

title: Hints and Help System Functionality and Scoring Impact
description: Validate that hints and detailed step-by-step guidance can be requested via keyboard shortcuts and that score is impacted accordingly.

steps.description: Start a game level with incomplete setup.
Use the keyboard shortcut assigned to request a general hint.
Verify that a relevant general hint dialog or message is displayed.
Use the keyboard shortcut to request detailed step-by-step guidance.
Verify that detailed guidance is presented sequentially and clearly.
Verify that the use of hints results in a reduction or impact on the player's score as defined by game rules.

title: Victory Celebration Activation
description: Ensure the victory confetti animation and sound effects trigger only upon successful validation of all required connections and level completion.

steps.description: Complete all required equipment placements and cable connections correctly for a given level.
Verify that the system detects level completion and triggers victory confetti animation.
Verify that victory sound effects play along with the animation.
Undo a critical connection making the level incomplete.
Verify that the victory animation and sound do not trigger if the setup is incomplete or invalid.

title: Keyboard Shortcuts Functional Coverage
description: Test that all keyboard shortcuts for game controls, hints, validation, debugging, and state management trigger their respective functions correctly.

steps.description: Press the keyboard shortcut for requesting a hint.
Verify the hint system triggers accordingly.
Press the shortcut for running connection validation on the current setup.
Verify connection validation is executed and feedback is displayed.
Press the shortcut for toggling debug mode/tools.
Verify debug tools are activated showing console output and visual highlights.
Press shortcuts for game controls like pause, reset, or save/load game state.
Verify these controls respond correctly without error.

title: Game State Persistence and Restoration
description: Ensure that game progress, equipment positions, connections, scores, and completed levels are saved to local storage and correctly restored on reload.

steps.description: Start a level and place equipment with some established connections.
Progress partially through the level and close or refresh the browser.
Verify that upon reopening the game, the previous game state including equipment positions, connections, and scores are accurately restored.
Make changes to the setup and save progress again.
Verify that the updated state overwrites the stored state correctly.
Delete local storage data manually then reload the game.
Verify that the game initializes to default initial state without error.

title: Audio Equipment Testing and Real-time Analysis
description: Verify audio equipment testing features using real-time microphone input and frequency analysis work properly in supported browsers.

steps.description: Place an audio equipment item on the stage with enabled audio testing.
Activate the audio testing mode on the equipment.
Verify that real-time frequency analysis visualization appears using microphone input.
Provide audio input via microphone or speakers.
Verify that the audio system captures and processes the input correctly and updates visual feedback accordingly.
Use an unsupported browser or deny microphone permission.
Verify that the system handles errors gracefully with user-friendly error messages and disables audio testing features.

title: Responsive Canvas Adaptability
description: Ensure the virtual stage canvas adapts to various screen sizes responsively without visual clipping or overflow.

steps.description: Load the game interface on desktop resolution.
Verify that the canvas fills available space correctly with all elements fully visible and contained.
Resize the browser window to a smaller tablet screen size.
Verify that the canvas and interface scale appropriately without content clipping or overflow.
Resize the browser window to a mobile phone resolution.
Verify the canvas responsiveness continues with equipment and connections visible and fully usable.
Rotate device orientation between portrait and landscape modes.
Verify layout adapts smoothly with no broken UI elements or lost functionality.

title: Debug Tools Functionality and Console Output
description: Confirm that debug tools activated via keyboard shortcuts produce detailed and accurate console output and visual highlights for connection issues.

steps.description: Place multiple equipment items and create both valid and invalid connections.
Press the keyboard shortcut to enable debug mode.
Verify console outputs detailed information on current connection states, validation results, and errors.
Verify visual highlights or overlays appear on the canvas indicating connection issues or important statuses as described.
Disable debug mode via shortcut.
Verify that console output returns to normal and visual debugging highlights are removed cleanly.
